root.name: Requiem: Avenging Angel
root.description: Requiem: Avenging Angel is a first-person shooter. It was developed by Cyclone Studios and Published by Ubisoft and 3DO. The game is heavily influenced by Bible and Christian mythology. The background story to the game is set in heaven. God was not satisfied with his creation – The Earth. Some of the angels in heaven thought that they should descend onto Earth and interpret God’s presumed desires. These angels are called The Fallen. You take control of Malachi. An angel and servant of God. You have to stop The Fallen angels and avert the apocalypse. The game is a standard first-person shooter although you can use some special powers (in similar manner to Jedi Knight) like slowing down time or possessing an enemy. This way you can access various weapons which cannot be used normally. Requiem: Avenging Angel was released in 1999 for Windows. PC Requirements Windows 95/88 or ME; Pentium 166 (Min.), Pentium 200 (Rec.); 4x CD-ROM drive; 32MB RAM (Min.); 2MB SVGA DirectX compatible, 4MB reccomended for D3D; DirectX compatible sound card; 116MB free hard drive space, 275MB recommended.
